intro: Linkia mitchellii, commonly known as Mitchell's linkia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
